meta_description: The Baker Museum is one of the foremost fine art museums in Southwest Florida. Emphasizing modern and contemporary art, the museum hosts several traveling exhibitions annually to complement installations of works from its permanent collections.
hours_text:
## Free Admission

* * *

#### _Enjoy free admission to The Baker Museum the last Wednesday of each month from 6pm to 9pm._

Artis—Naples invites the community to enjoy Art After Hours at The Baker Museum on the last Wednesday of each month from 6pm to 9pm. With live music performed by local musicians, food and beverages available for purchase at Heidi’s Place, and free admission to all museum exhibitions, Art After Hours is a fun evening of art and entertainment for audiences of all ages.

####  Museum  
Admission

[ ](/baker-museum/admission)

[__Museum Tickets](/baker-museum/admission)

* * *

The Artis—Naples box office accepts all major credit cards, checks and cash. Tickets can be purchased online, over the phone by calling 239-597-1900, or in person at our box office on the Kimberly K. Querrey and Louis A. Simpson Cultural Campus. Tickets can also be purchased by mailing your order to Artis—Naples, 5833 Pelican Bay Boulevard, Naples, Florida, 34108.

A nominal handling fee is applied to ticket sales made by mail, web and phone. There are no fees for purchases made in person at our box office. Telephone handling fees for single ticket purchases are waived for [**supporters of Artis—Naples**](/support) at the $2,500 level and above.

accessibility_text:
#### _For Those with Mobility Needs_

A patron services representative will be happy to assist with any special seating needs when you purchase your tickets. Courtesy wheelchairs are available at the main entrance of Hayes Hall (an easy drop-off location). There are accessible restrooms on both floors of Hayes Hall and in Daniels Pavilion. Patrons with limited mobility or who prefer to park on the Kimberly K. Querrey and Louis A. Simpson Cultural Campus should plan on arriving early for performances to allow themselves plenty of time to find a parking spot.

[__ **Campus Map**](/visit/map-directions)

* * *

#### _For the Deaf or Hearing Impaired_

Artis—Naples has a hearing loop system so people with hearing aids and cochlear implants with telecoil technology will have amplified sound sent directly to their devices when activated for events in Hayes Hall, Daniels Pavilion, Rowe Center and Ubben Signature Event Space. Wireless listening devices are also available free of charge.

* * *

#### _For Those with Sensory Sensitivities_

Artis—Naples is Sensory Inclusive Certified through KultureCity to support guests with sensory needs. Sensory bags containing noise-reducing headphones, fidget tools, visual cue cards and more may be checked out at the patron desk, free of charge, by patrons of all ages. These tools help reduce sensory overload and create a more comfortable experience during performances and other activities on our cultural campus. When finished, patrons are asked t...
